self.philbrown.javaQuery
Class AsyncSocket

java.lang.Object
  self.philbrown.javaQuery.AsyncSocket

public class AsyncSocket
extends java.lang.Object

This is the master NIO Async Socket class. Supports UDP and TCP, IPv4 and IPv6, and both server and client connections.
In its current implementation, this class does not check the current binded or connected status of a socket, and thus Exceptions can arise if a binded socket attempts to connect to a remote port.

Author:
Phil Brown

Nested Class Summary
static interface AsyncSocket.Listener
          Listens for socket events and reacts to them via callback methods

bindToPort

public void bindToPort(java.lang.String address,
                       int port)
                throws java.io.IOException
Binds this socket to listen for incoming connections on the given port number.

Parameters:
ipaddress - the address to bind to. If null, the default (0.0.0.0) will be used.
port - the number of the port to open
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an i/o error occurs

                       boolean blocking)
                throws java.io.IOException
Binds this socket to listen for incoming connections on the given port number.

Parameters:
port - the number of the port to open
blocking - set to true to force this thread to block until a connection is received

connectToAddress

public void connectToAddress(java.net.InetAddress _address,
                             int port)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Connects this socket to the remote host at the given port number, without blocking this thread

Parameters:
_address - the remote IP Address to which to connect.
port - the number of the port to open
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - if the given address is not IPv6 for a IPv6 socket, or likewise for IPv4.
java.io.IOException - if an i/o error occurs

enableBroadcast

public void enableBroadcast()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.NullPointerException
Enable broadcast datagrams. This must be enabled for a UDP socket to send or receive broadcasts.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the socket is closed or the option could not be set
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the socket is null. This will occur if bindToPort(int) or #connectToPort(int) has not yet been called.
